result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Kwik Trip Stores. Must pay $100 fee to get dog back from Humane Society. DE's father granted option to pick up dog.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert C Plutshack appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Fran Rivard appears via Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Rivard - unsure if client rcvd complaint. 
DE - rcvd complaint.
Atty Rivard - waives reading. 
State - req $1,000 cash bond. No contact with Kwik Trip Stores. Humane Society requesting DE only be allowed to rcvd dog back with specific time set up and pay impound fee.
Atty Rivard - Asks court to apply cash posted from a prior case to this case. Usually DE is taken into custody with his dog. Argues against impound fee for return of dog. DE's father could possibly pick up dog from Humane Society. Argues for lower cash bond.
State - new charges involve possession of Meth. Fee to get dog back is $100.
Court - orders $100 cash bond. No contact with Kwik Trip Stores. Must pay $100 fee to get dog back from Humane Society. DE's father granted option to pick up dog.
Atty Rivard - waives time limits on prelim. Has court in BR 1 on 7/1/22 at 10:30 am.
